argument.name: uri
uri
argument.description: A url or path to a WSDL

argument.name: o
argument.description: Specify a directory path for the generated code

argument.name: a
argument.description: Generate async style code only (Default: off)

argument.name: s
argument.description: Generate sync style code only (Default: off). Takes precedence over -a

argument.name: p
argument.description: Specify a custom package name for the generated code

argument.name: l
argument.description: Valid languages

argument.name: t
argument.description: Generate a test case for the generated code

argument.name: ss
argument.description: Generate server side code (i.e. skeletons)

argument.name: sd
argument.description: Generate service descriptor (i.e. services.xml). Valid with -ss

argument.name: d
argument.description: Valid databinding(s)

argument.name: g
argument.description: Generates all the classes. Valid only with -ss

argument.name: pn
argument.description: Port name. Choose a specific port when there are multiple ports in the wsdl

argument.name: sn
argument.description: Service name. Choose a specific service when there are multiple services in the wsdl

argument.name: u
argument.description: Unpacks the databinding classes

argument.name: r
argument.description: Specify a repository against which code is generated

argument.name: ns2p
argument.description: ns1=pkg1,ns2=pkg2 .Specify a custom package name for each namespace specified in the wsdls schema

argument.name: ssi
argument.description: Generate an interface for the service implementation

argument.name: wv
argument.description: WSDL Version

argument.name: S
argument.description: Specify a directory path for generated source

argument.name: R
argument.description: Specify a directory path for generated resources

argument.name: em
argument.description: Specify an external mapping file

argument.name: f
argument.description: Flattens the generated files

argument.name: uw
argument.description: Switch on un-wrapping

argument.name: xsdconfig
xsdconfig
argument.description: Use XMLBeans .xsdconfig file. Valid only with -d xmlbeans

argument.name: ap
argument.description: Generate code for all ports

argument.name: or
argument.description: Overwrite the existing classes

argument.name: b
argument.description: Generate Axis 1.x backword compatible code

argument.name: sp
argument.description: Suppress namespace prefixes (Optimzation that reduces size of soap request/response)

argument.name: Emp
argument.description: Package name for ADB. Extension mapper package name

argument.name: Eosv
argument.description: (for ADB) - off strict validation

argument.name: Ebindingfile
Ebindingfile
argument.description: File path to your JiBX binding definition
